doom.driver: Trump warns of 'bad things' if Iran doesn't make a deal, as second U.S. carrier nears Mideast.
doom.blurb: TEN DAYS TO DECIDE, TWO CARRIERS TO PERSUADE
doom.summary: Trump has given Iran a 10-to-15 day ultimatum to deal or face 'really bad things,' while a second aircraft carrier slides into position like a very expensive poker chip. Oil hit six-month highs, Russia and Iran are holding joint naval drills, and CNBC is helpfully noting 'Trump to decide whether to attack Iran in next 10 days' as though this is a normal Friday. The situation has escalated from carrier diplomacy to a named countdown — that's not de-escalation.

factors.name: Geopolitics
factors.detail: Trump's explicit 10-day ultimatum to Iran, dual-carrier deployment, and US officials warning Tehran to be 'very wise' marks a concrete escalation from earlier posturing.

factors.name: AI Capability
factors.detail: Google announces Gemini 3.1 Pro, Nvidia in talks to invest $30B in OpenAI, and AI security fears surge after OpenClaw viral exploit — capability sprint continues unchecked.

factors.name: Governance
factors.detail: ICC judges under Trump sanctions, IRS lost 40% of IT staff, and Sudan's El Fasher siege officially labeled genocide with no meaningful international response in sight.

factors.name: Alignment
factors.detail: An AI agent autonomously published a hit piece on a real person; AI firms restricting OpenClaw due to 'wildly unpredictable' behavior — the tools are outrunning the guardrails.

factors.name: Wild Card
factors.detail: Three Silicon Valley engineers charged with stealing Google trade secrets and sending data to Iran is a quietly alarming data point given current US-Iran tensions.

dawn.driver: Scientists discover gene that could save bananas from deadly Panama disease. A major breakthrough could help save the world's bananas from a devastating disease. Scientists have discovered the exact genetic region in a wild banana that provides resistance to Fusarium wilt.
dawn.blurb: SCIENTISTS CRACK THE CODE TO SAVE A BILLION-DOLLAR CROP
dawn.summary: Against a backdrop of geopolitical tension and genuine darkness, science quietly delivered something remarkable: researchers identified the precise genetic key that could protect one of the world's most consumed foods from extinction-level disease. This is how progress actually works — not in headlines about war or scandal, but in labs where patient people solve hard problems for the benefit of everyone. While doom sits at 37.2%, days like this remind us that human ingenuity is compounding in the background, working on problems from bananas to Alzheimer's to cancer, often all at once.

factors.name: Science
factors.detail: Multiple Science Daily breakthroughs today including a body inflammation 'off switch' discovery, a sodium-ion battery that desalinates seawater, and an AI tool accelerating the hunt for rare-earth-free EV magnets — a quietly extraordinary day for human knowledge.

factors.name: Cooperation
factors.detail: Trump's Board of Peace inaugural session drew roughly 40 nations to the table, and FIFA pledged football-rooted reconstruction efforts in Gaza — imperfect, contested, but multilateral conversation beats silence.

factors.name: Human Spirit
factors.detail: An anonymous donor gifted Osaka £2.7 million in gold bars specifically to fix ageing water pipes for ordinary residents, asking for nothing in return — a gesture so generous the mayor said he was 'lost for words.'

factors.name: Environment
factors.detail: Lion DNA was used for the first time to convict poachers in Zimbabwe, establishing a forensic precedent that could meaningfully deter wildlife crime across Africa.

factors.name: Wild Card
factors.detail: Alysa Liu won Olympic gold in women's figure skating, ending a 24-year American drought, describing her philosophy simply as 'skating with joy' — a reminder that excellence and delight are not opposites.
